Class Peg

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.AbstractButton
            • javax.swing.JButton
              • Peg
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.ItemSelectable, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.SwingConstants

    public class Peg
extends javax.swing.JButton
    This is the peg class. It contains the basic information on the pegs, which are the meat of a mastermind game. They extend JButton. Originally, they were going to be circular, but I decided against it later.
    Author:
    swynsma18
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Peg

        public Peg(java.lang.String D)
        Standard constructor for peg. Takes a string representing the difficulty and sets the peg to the color red. This is used for non-solution rows, the ones that appear in the interface.
        Parameters:
        D - is the difficulty, which decides which colors the peg can change between.

      • Peg

        public Peg(java.lang.String A,
           java.lang.String D)
        This is the peg function generally used for solutions. It sets the color based on the string passed.
        Parameters:
        A - = the color that the peg will be. Is set based on a constructor in row.
        D - = the difficulty. Passed into here from row.

    • Method Detail

      • changeColor

        public void changeColor()
        This function changes the color of the pegs in a sequence. When a peg is clicked, this is called. The sequence is red-blue-green-orange-purple-(black)-(cyan)-(yellow). Black does not appear on easy difficulty. Cyan and yellow only appear on impossible difficulty. Note that this function changes both the background color of the peg and the AvailColor enum of the peg.

      • compareColor

        public boolean compareColor(Peg P)
        This function checks to see if a peg has the same color as another peg.
        Parameters:
        P - the peg that the current peg is being compared to.
        Returns:
        true if the pegs match color (also sets Counted to true, which prevents this from being called again in Row.java). false if the pegs do not match

      • getColor

        public Peg.AvailColor getColor()
        Gets the current AvailColor variable.
        Returns:
        AvailColor.

      • getActionListener

        public java.awt.event.ActionListener getActionListener()
        Gets the action listener for this peg
        Returns:
        the action listener for this peg.

      • IsCounted

        public boolean IsCounted()
        Checks to see if the peg has been counted in the compareRows function in Row.
        Returns:
        true/false, depending on the value of isCounted.

      • SetCounted

        public void SetCounted(boolean B)
        Sets isCounted to true/false depending on the situation.
        Parameters:
        B - true if in compare color, false if in reset solution.
